Level One / Youth Worker Coaching Certificate

Level One Youth Worker Coaching Certificate wants to gather 30 youth workers from 14 countries for an 8 day-training in rural Austria directed towards tackling the challenges posed today by youth unemployment and NEETs.The TC will be an innovative combination of in-dept training on coaching methodologies with outdoor activities and the power of myth, rituals and storytelling as tools for youth work.

Despite the positive signals in the EU economy and labor market in the years following the crisis, youth unemployment and NEETs remains largely a priority issue, especially concerning the growing income disparity in large urban areas, rural migration and the necessary inclusion of refugees and migrants into the European labor market in order to foster sustainable integration and prevent the radicalization of young people. 

Coaching is a learning support measure seldomly used in youth work, and often mistook for either mentoring or counselling. We want to introduce to youth organisations the good practice to have a coach figure, to constantly monitor the development and learning of the youth NGO members as well as their target groups (especially youth vulnerable to NEET situations including refugees, migrants and other marginalized groups). 
Our participant target group is youth workers and volunteers with already some experience in supporting the learning and empowerment of young people. The TC aims to equip them with that extra gear that can allow them to more easily achieve their vision and mission. 

The Level One Youth Workers Coaching Certification sees a path that starts from exploring coaching from the perspective of self-coaching and self-awareness, to coaching others and empower towards self-awareness and goal achievement. Participants will experience through experiential learning, non-formal education and value-based learning a journey across psychology, philosophy, pedagogy and social anthropology. They are going to gain tools, self-awareness, attitudes and competences that will later benefit the target groups of their youth NGOs back home, when being walked through their action plans supported by their peers and the training team. This will be done through an innovative educational path: From Values and Environment analysis created by Prof. C. Graves, over exploring how Dr. Campbell's Monomyth theory is not only an excellent tool for storywriting and story-telling, but also a fantastic tool for coaching towards transformation, participants will travel through the existing models and tools available in corporate and business coaching such as GROW, NLP, and Jungian Archetypes, up to the more attitude-development methodologies implemented by Dr. Plotkin in using outdoor education. 

Participants, besides being trained and certified as youth coaches, will receive a YouthPass Certificate, the Rescogita OU Certification as Coaches (upon demonstration of having conducted at least 20 hours of coaching and reporting it), a manual for Youth Coaching, and a voucher for 1 hour distance coaching. Thus, the training programme contains specific elements that foster the dissemination of aquired knowledge in the participants organisations later on.

"Voievodul Gelu" Technological High School in Zalau is an educational institution with tradition in Salaj county. Technological high schools in our city, including our school, have experienced a setback in terms of the request from the secondary school graduates. Our students 60 % come from rural families with low economic potential, mostly commuters, some of them reaching to school after more than 40 km of commuting.

Although the school has a boarding and canteen, families that can afford to financially support accommodation and meals for their children, enrolled in upper secondary and professional education, are becoming fewer. Still referring to our students, we can say that we have many situations in which emotionally, they are confronted with major problems due to an unstable family environment, with divorced parents, or parents working abroad, with scarce financial resources, with cases of domestic violence and alcohol consumption, single parent families, orphans, institutionalized, etc.
 We want to organize a project intended for pupils in risk/vulnerable groups: orphans from orphanages, institutionalized, from families with modest incomes, Rroma students; 15 students in these groups to participate in an internship for the professional qualification as a waiter.

80% of our students come from vulnerable groups at risk: orphans in foster care, Rroma families with low income, at risk of drop-out, etc. Especially for orphan students from orphanages, from rural area and with a low income, we want to offer the chance to a good training in Northern Ireland, in partnership with NW Academy because it is their only chance to benefit from a qualitative vocational training in the European context. Most students have not had the chance to break out of the county boundaries, they have experienced a hard living; there is a case in which he has lost both parents and commutes to get to school, from an orphan’s scholarship leads his life so as to cope with the burdens. NWA is an educational institution that manages European nobilities for different professional profiles, annually providing services to more than 1000 students.




Objectives:
 O1. The 15 participants to acquire professional skills in setting up menus and serve dishes and drinks to foreign tourists
 O2. The 15 student attendees will develop competencies in serving food and drinks to foreign tourists, through a deeper understanding of their preferences as well as adapt their professional behavior according to the requirements arising
 O3. Civic competence development for the 15 participants through the rigorous fulfillment of the tasks within the project 
04. The development of the competence -learning to learn- of the 15 participants by assuming responsibility, general rules of serving foreign clients '
 O6. Communication skills in English and intercultural skills
 O7. The 15 participants from risk groups to complete the education cycle, achieving an immediate insertion in local or European context
Mobility will be organized in 10 days of activity, in which participants guided by their tutor in the placement units will undertake the practice activities from the curriculum for level 3, waiter. There will be achieved: the competence unit -Setting up menus-serving food and drinks which includes the competence –The serving of dietetic food and beverages, drinks and dishes for foreign tourists.
Outcomes:
 1Intangibile at the level of each participant in terms of academic and professional knowledge in setting up menus and serving dishes and drinks, competences such as: preparing menus, serving drinks and food for breakfast, lunch, dinner and banquets, serving tourists; communication skills in English, civic and social competences in the rigorous task and procedure  achievement, the spirit of initiative marking entrepreneurial skills, positive attitude to work and life, learning, behavior adapted to the modern Northern Irish context.
We expect that during the 10 days of practice the participants will experience considerable progress both personally and professionally, to redefine their self-esteem; to feel respected and valued motivating them in to accomplish medium and long term professional and academic growth.
2 Tangible outcomes, portfolio of practice to be created within the traineeship including daily scenario, procedure for daily activities, examples of good practice, local serving techniques, forms of communication adapted to the cultural context of each client in particular of the foreigners. These materials will be organized on their return to the country in order to be useful to teachers and students at the vocational qualification waiter.

The project THREE is addressed to 120 students of an network of 4 Secondary schools situated in the area called “Bassa Padovana, in the Venetian Region.
These technical and vocational schools have a wide and articulated educational offer, where professional profiles have been identified to include in the project as they are coherent with the project reference themes.
The project is aimed at 4th  and 5th year students (that is the final cycle of studies of upper secondary education) and the mobility will start from May 2015, and will last five weeks.
The vocational reference field is tourism with a particular attention towards the agro-food and services, including those aimed at care and wellness of the person, whose macro area includes marketing and administration functions and the integration of cross-curricular competences in the linguistic field as well as in the management of territory.
The reference contexts are characterized by the economy affected by the strong impact of economic and financial crisis in terms of decrease in jobs.
At the same time, the statistic surveys highlight the difficulty to modify behaviours and organization models by small companies, due to historic and cultural conditioning which are very rooted and that limit the necessary innovation processes with the persistence of  genre and ethnic stereotypes.
In this context, one of the project goals is to enhance the relationships with “the other”, either at genre, at cultural or origin level, helping the young to feel the difference as a resource and not only as a limit.
A mature and open approach towards intercultural differences together with the development of the concept of the company social responsibility, is one of the key elements to trigger revitalization  processes et new employments creation on a new ground closely linked to the territory potentialities. 
On the professional level the goals of the project concern the reinforcement of the knowledge of foreign languages, linked, above all, to the language for special purposes of the different reference contexts and the growth of knowledge and technical competences that are a spur also for new work organization models .  
The young will experience abroad  the contact with different cultures that let them start synergies and  cooperation processes and  acquire innovative organizational models at social content, to recreate the operational context of reference. 
The learning outcomes in terms of acquired competences will be assessed and validated by applying  the ECVET procedures to make them  recognition .
The work experience is integrated in the school educational curriculum and it is recognised as a compulsory training within the dual school-work scheme.
The internships will take place in companies operating in the specific professional fields in Austria, France, UK, Ireland,  Spain.
The quantitative, qualitative and  methodological results of the project will be shared among the participants partners of the network, during all the period of the project by using the web and IT tools and they will be presented during a final seminar to local institutions and to companies of the territory , and at the same  time Europass Mobility will be given to the participants.

The consortium of schools of economics (Celje School of Economics, Novo mesto School of Economics, Secondary School of Economics Ljubljana and Secondary School Slovenj Gradec and Muta) has formed partnership with partners in Spain, the United Kingdom, Malta and Portugal for the purpose of collaborating in the mobility project for secondary school students from four regions that is taking place from June 2014 until June 2015. We are aiming at organising a placement for 106 of our secondary vocational and technical school students for a period of two to three weeks respectively. The duration of their placements has been adjusted to their curricula. All partners are aiming at enabling our participants to get an excellent mobility experience, help them upgrade their speaking abilities in English or teach them the basics of Spanish/Portuguese, which means granting their wish. We are going to work hard to broaden their horizons to such an extent so that foreign languages will no longer be a problem but a challenge, we would like them to understand the notion of multicultural existence and be able to live among and with different kinds of people, we want to encourage the use of their professional skills in foreign work environment and gain new skills, including soft skills which are becoming increasingly sought after by employers. It is necessary they become aware of the importance of lifelong learning and training as Europe offers excellent opportunities for international cooperation, networking and exchange of expertise. For the majority of our students it will be an all-first time: the first flight, the first time away from their parents, for the first time so far away from home but all that has so far immensely contributed to their strengthened self-confidence. The project is also of utmost importance for all partner schools as mobility activities raise our international profile and attract a greater number of students who want to enrol in our schools. At the same time it provides valuabe new experiences for all of us. We are aiming at increasing the number of mobilities in comparison to previous years, improve the students' openness and independence. At the same time we want to strengthen our collaboration with foreign partners and keep improving our mobility practice by learning also from their rich experience. Mobility is an added value to our educational programmes and it diversifies everyday activities in all our partner schools.
Rozvoj kompetencií v službách a remeslách

The project called “Develoment of the competencies in the service industries and crafts” is designed for students of the Secondary United School in Brezno. The students study in the teaching fields of innkeeper, joiner, manufacture of ready-mode clothes and in the study fields of catering industry, entrepreneur school and computer mechanic. Twenty four students will be participated in this project. The project is focused on student`s needs: the developing of professional, linguistic, cultural-social skills and competencies in the initial vocational training in the sphere of crafts and services.
 The internship will take place in two countries and in four partner organizations. The first three organizations are the secondary vocational schools in the Czech Republic and the fourth organization is North West Academy of English in Northern Ireland:
 1. The Secondary School of Hotel services and Gastronomy in Prague organizes four week internship for four students of gastronomy fields (waiter, cook) in the hotels and restaurants in Prague.
 2. The Business Academy and Secondary technical school of General F. Fajtl in Louny assures mobility for four students in the field of manufacture of ready-made clothes in the school tailor`s workshop. During three-week mobility students go through the whole technology process of sewing clothes.
 3. Secondary Vocational School and Secondary Technical School SCMSD in Znojmo arranges three week practice for four joiners in the companies focused on the production of furniture.
 4. Nord West Academy of English in Londonderry secures five - week internship for twelve students. Four computer mechanics will be located at the University of Ulster in Londonderry where they will be participated on the management and maintenance of computers and their networks. Four students of entrepreneur school will carry out practice in the business companies and commercial firms. Four students will work in the different departments of catering industry as waiters and cooks.
 The main aim of the project is to acquire new professional skills and personality growth of participants in order to improve opportunities to make them useful on the domestic and European labour market.
 Another aim of the project is to works up the attraction and sense of technical vocational education especially for participants of the internship, secondarily for their schoolmates, parents and more general public. By means of dissemination of project results to motivate the other students, tutors, teachers of vocational practice to improve the quality of education and their personality growth.
 It is supposed that the participants of the project will gain bigger independence, healthier self – confidence, adaptation in the new labour conditions and the participants will take over the models of good practice and competences in communication. Big portion of students in initial training in the teaching fields are students form social – weak environment and Rome families, and their financial background are difficult and complicated and the taking part of the individual activities is for our students also much more valuable because it is many times for most of them single opportunity of education in foreign surroundings. 
 From the implementation of the project we expect also the creation of the new products in the form of promotion brochures and the on-line two – lingual dictionary with vocational technical – technological terminologies for the individual teaching fields and three lingual collections of the formulas national meals of participating countries. 
There is priority of use new experiences in conditions of school practice and consequently their transfer into the teaching syllabi of the school educational programme. 
After completing the internship the participants of the project get Europass-Mobility, the assessment of students´ results by tutors and the certificate of completing internship from the partner organizations.

The Colegiul National "Simion Barnutiu" from Simleu Silvaniei, Romania is a general upper secondary school preparing students in several study lines as mathematics-informatics, natural sciences, philology and economics. In the IXth to the XIIth grades there are 696 students prepared by 45 teachers of various specializations.

The managing team of the school has identified some general needs of the school, needs generating specific needs of the teachers in the field of in-service training. Thus a mobility project has emerged trying to fulfill the identified needs.

The mobility project aims to answer to the following general needs:
- In the field of student centered pedagogical methods using extensive IT approaches during the classes
- Extending the number of teachers with extended foreign language competences (EN and FR), both for philology and non-philology teachers, ensuring thus the ability of the teacher to being involved in different projects and international collaboration actions.

Taking in account the stated needs three main objectives of the project emerge:
- Involving the teachers in training activities capable to diversify the applied didactical methodology, centering it on the students as the main beneficiaries of the learning.
- development among the teachers the digital competencies in informational medium, extending the didactical methodology relying on ICT and focusing on the use of interactive main boards.
- development of communication competencies in foreign language both for philology teacher and non philology ones (promoting CLIL techniques and the involvement in international collaboration)

Envisaged activities are :
- a 2 weeks job shadowing (observation period) for 8 teachers in St Joseph's School, Londonderry, UK
- in-service training courses for three teachers in the field of developing modern languages in St Julien MT, Lille FR and Oxford UK.

Expected results described in general terms: operating during the classes with various didactical methods raising the percentage of the IT based didactical methodology as of the on-line harvested information; the integration of ICT and CLIL in the class using extensively the IT equipments and the foreign language competences, extending thus the available information sources. On long term this impact will raise the quality of the education, will diversify the pedagogical approaches and will promote crosscurricular didactical approaches allowing a student centered learning.
Szakértők multimédiás tapasztalatcseréje a szakképzés oktatásán keresztül - Multimedia Experiences of Experts and Tutors via Vocational Education and Training

The project of MEET via VET (Multimedia Experiences of Experts and Tutors via Vocational Education and Training) involves 14 participants of tutors and stakeholders with VET. The beneficiaries are tutors, teachers and stakeholders, who are experts in theoretical and practical education of vocational training. They carry out the project of knowledge exchange via vocational oriented education. The project focuses on learning new elements, methods of VET in order to deepen and widen the vocational skills and to implement and apply the most-up-dated and latest Information and Communication Technologies combined Multimedia Applications through the channel of Vocational English. The major aim of the project  to refine vocational English in VET and to specify interactions, dialogues and intercommunication in sound, photo, video and digitalized formats to represent ESP. Tutors of the team have the strength to possess the VET orientation and knowledge while students' strength is to be able to utilize the modern multimedia tools as on their daily basis. Youngsters have a primary skill to gain knowledge by ICT but tutors have the secondary skill in the same theme. Tutors and stakeholders acquire and sort out the compulsory, authentic, thematic studies, and they are to select the original and life-like interactions. ESP such as Vocational English applies online platforms as they are spread by everyday use. Having learnt the acquired knowledge youngsters and their tutors as well should learn the time-bounding and time measuring techniques in infochange.  Participants of MEET via VET project take part in workshops, technical visits dealing with the following topics; - teaching techniques in filtering methods, scanning and skimming reading, - recording vocational dialogues, - identifying vocational language terms,- demonstrate creative learning activities, - operate smart techniques and put these applications into practice. Life-long learning is essential in the world of dynamic, ongoing changes to be able to answer the world of digital reality and virtual knowledge-based issues. The stages of traditional education have changed as education is interwoven by IT platforms which are popular with teens. In addition to this, it supports professional development in vocational training too. Our project targets the educational exchanges to deepen the professional development of tutors by the authentic, vocational English and enlarge the information-flow with the best practices. Beneficiaries of MEET via VET assist to acknowledge and find the best solution to uncover parallel modules and similarities into the trades' modules. During the mobility each element of specific components and skills is the display of trades. Having learnt the trades’ specifications would mean not only applying the general studies but also obtaining multilateral scopes in education as well.  Our experts are empowered by the knowledge and acquaintance of native, social contact in VET. Consequently, our project overall aim is: to support the participants in developing their VET +ESP expertises, develop their capacities in order to transfer information channelled by ICT applications and their added value. Steps of programme realization:1. Project planning with the guidance of participants (list project aims, goals) 2. Project Management Schedule 3. Presentation of Theme content plan of the 2-week-period 4. Preparatory studies (8 events) in Miskolc based on the Learning Agreement and MOU  signed by NWA  5. Project realization in Northern Ireland mentoring, monitoring and evaluation. 6. Implementation 7. Dissemination and follow up activities. Each member of MEET via VET works out the daily report and feed-back surveys. Finally our project outcomes will be planted in the educational concept of our institute and vocational schools in the region.
Dual Approaches of Vocational Education and Training  - A Duális Képzés Értelmezése a Szakképzés és Oktatás terén

The project main goals of 'Dual Approaches of Vocational Education and Training’ focus on introducing dual vocational education and training with new approaches and methods. The 14 participants of MIOK-JNGSZI are experienced, well-qualified tutors, experts, mentors and project coordinators of ongoing themes. All of them have a good command of Vocational English and they fluently communicate in it so they are open to acquire new knowledge and approaches in the theme. After altering the previous vocational education and training, which required more theory versus training, our ‘DAVET’ project introduces the new dual training system with schemes and approaches. In our project the emphasis is based on the identification of balanced training with additional theory.  Updated work placement managing schemes, trade modules, the institutional background provide and propose outstanding opportunities to modify dual VET. Participants also swot up and assess the transparency in crediting system of vocational training. The project is launched to implement new initiative in VET to be able to spread new methods by its experts. Participants could give guidance, supervise motivated students to integrate them into workplaces when the importance of VET knowledge is redefined and re-evaluated by possessing vocational education and trade skills. North West Academy of English organizes and presents the project work in Derry with introducing dual vocational educational and training, supporting applied methods and algorithms and mapping the places of ‘best-practice’. During the 2-week-project, demo institutions, practice and workplaces will be observed. Economical and social transition in Derry region resulted positive effects on students’ studying in vocational education and training. By choosing the tailor-made skills and trades students have possession of encouraging employment. Project experts require learning exchanges, each of them has to change teaching attitude and behaviour and out-of-date manners to be able to use the fresh, up-to date initiatives and implement them in Hungary. The project highlights the standards, values and the path to follow in dual VET. In Hungary there is no mutual partnership between the vocational school-work placement-chamber, the cooperation of 3 is not fully- formed our project suggests alternatives how to organize a framework of that collaboration. The project work includes technical visits and in-situ VET solutions. Participants list and record the teamwork and in-progress partnership of 3 (vocational school-work placement-social enterprise) and we also have a dispute and debate on its development. The 2-week-project is divided into 2 phases: 1. Explore and In-Progress Week 2. Reorganize and Impact Week.  In Derry NWA takes charge of the work programme; visiting educational institutions to provide workshops, seminars, meetings, open dialogues and brainstorming discussions and to comprehend the project priorities. The following terms will be established; Practice &Theory Integration, VET Area Reorganization, Decentralized Dual Training , Social Exclusion and Inclusion in VET, Melting Points with Skill, Job Fairs and Schooling with Preventional Education. 'DAVET'  project emphasizes the importance of cooperation of empowered, skilled tutors- students and supporting collaboration of master-student- teacher to broadcast effectiveness to students’ schooling. Our project praises the importance of VET with professional skills to be able to make a benefit of the trained knowledge in a disadvantageous social and financial background. Besides the above mentioned advantages, our future depends on how we rely on applying the changing attitude of experts and tutors in dual training. In Derry region brand new reorganizing and integrating plans worked and carried out some years ago, which meet our project demands. In Northern Ireland the well-planned and outlined regeneration projects are widely spread which suggest finding solutions and answer the same features like we have in our region. Our project team systematizes and organizes the new trends and methods shown during the study visit and brings all best-practices together. During  'DAVET' project experts are able to learn one-to-one, they change educational methodologies and they learn new competencies from each other, cooperative learning vehicles are developed. By our project multicultural, intercultural, formal and informal settings are appraised. Project participants’ profits put on view in their professional and personal development. Each project impact is applied and implemented. Short-phased consequence: MIOK-JNGSZI updates its curriculum after sharing high-quality, unique and constructive experiences in dual VET.  Long-phased consequence: dissemination spreads the outcome and entire revenue of the project, in this our institution has a long-run project partnership with University of Miskolc and Türr István Research and Educational Institution.
Smart And Traditional education on Secondary Art Trades - "Okos" technológiákat és tradícionális oktatási módszereket magába foglaló művészeti szakképzés oktatása

In the project titled “2 SAT” 16 participants of BGY-REMAK are involved. They are mentors, tutors who intend to gain and utilize experiences during the 14-day- study visit in Northern Ireland. The project focuses on learning new modules of vocational training and education to modernize the applied technologies and balance the traditional and advanced ICT applications in secondary education. The project title - Smart And Traditional education on Secondary Art Trades describes, details the main priorities of the study period. The major goal is to upgrade the vocational training while using up-to-date methods and digital techniques. We are aiming to harmonize different elements when combining the instructive (traditional) and constructive (modern) pedagogy via vocational education in theory and practice. Our major tasks:1.) In general: VET is continuously changing and experts, mentors openly follow the modifications, alterations, refreshed themes, structures which are essentially needed in education of theory with practice. Refined schemes are need to be introduced to broaden acquaintances in order to be appropriate and relevant in the integrated European vocational education and training. Since there are good practices of the EU established in Londonderry, we are ready to study the latest interactions engaging our experts’ personal development to be able to improve education. 2.)  Specifications: BGY-REMAK has Graphic Designer (54-211-04) Moving Image and Animation Designer (54-213-03) Theatre  Dancer (54-212-09) classes. Educational modules of the 3 trades are to modify, refresh the subjects of VET and fuse them with smart schooling, digital means and ICT advancement. Divisions of art and media studies are combined. Without their synthesis the netgeneration could not exist or might be uninterested, old-fashioned and dumb. The challenging duty for tutors is to make progress and broadcast both the added value of traditional modes and spreading innovative approaches, smart techniques in the same way. By the experts’ mobility, mentors of VET are able to complete changing of educational experiences, knowledge transfer in a mutual assistance. In the project of BGY-REMAK new approaches are implemented and multimedia essentials of education have been harmonized with the art and media trades’ orientation. Mentors teaching vocational education propose to develop trades’ skills and select the most appropriate trade-orientated implication. They get easy access to authentic online, smart platforms, and applications leading to promotion. In a multicultural inspiring background the participants’ knowledge is widened, they are experienced by fulfilling the project tasks. Using a foreign language in a country with different cultural features makes the members of the project team be empowered and more self-confident. It also develops the individuals skill of problem-solving. VET is on a transition and applying multimedia and basic ICT tools are in common. Students are devoted to merge VET skills with digital competencies and make transfusion according to the labour market. Londonderry takes the advantages of owning the title of ‘the City of Culture’ of when it evolves the regeneration and reorganization processes in educational fields as well. Each consequence of social inclusion in education and media is introduced by NWA. Tutors are provided by ideas about quality smart-schooling. Project priority outlines the trade-orientation + all smart tools + social inclusion which are in an educational entity and presented in workshops. “2 SAT” project realizes a 2-week-study mobility carrying out workshops, meetings. Realizations of technical visits: NWA, North West Regional College, Nerve Centre, Fab Lab, Playhouse, Community Art Centre , People’s Gallery of Murals, Belfast Titanic Interactive Museum, Rutledge Recruitment & Training, and The HUB. Steering Group Meetings, and talk shops wish to change and share views, opinions. “2 SAT” project support effective and creative learning by using ICT, smart platforms in the dynamic and rapidly developing VET when preparing for final trades’ exams. Smart communicational tools generate interviews, videos, clips and blog outcomes, which are recorded in the transition of interactive knowledge material. Participants make reports on Facebook and blogspot sites. Individual smart learning kits (photos, clips,interviews) are created with knowledge-skills-competency features. After sharing high-quality, unique and constructive experiences each project impact, knowledge-based and value disseminating actions implemented in our Institutional Educational Plan, educational concept and syllabus. Dissemination acts spread the outcome and entire revenue of the project, in our institution has a long-run project contribution to the schools of Balázs Győző Líceum and the institutions of TIREK. Consequently, the project outcomes are face-to-face and widely spread in the region and country.
Discover Informal Education to Reduce Early School Leaving

European Union as being the foundation which is very sensitive to the education issue and scientific researches, takes up its position. It maintains all the oppotunities in terms of facilitating the education circumstances which has already had rate of literacy 99,9 %.
 European Union specified its frame in order to reach the 2020 targets which is determined by The Erasmus + Programme. Accordingly the importance of education and its place is vital. Nowadays, when the rate of school leaving is concerned by research community center Eurostat, the rate appeals to be 12 % among European Union of 28 countries. (the rate of lycee graduates between the ages of 18-24 )
But the rate of Turkey appeals to be 38%, which means that Turkey should struggle more in this area.  Concerning that Turkey will join the European Union and the target of EU is %10 for 2020, taking some precautions is a must for Turkey.
 It shows the necessity of writing a Project on this issue, proving the reasons of school leaving in order to decrease the amount .
 The Project period includes the examination of school leavings in details, about the relationship between  inclusion and exclusion, by preparing inquiries  of application of common public education and formal training together, leaving schools and  it also includes the school visits.
